newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's banking activity up in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's banking activity up in 1996.

text.p: The consolidated balance sheet of Lebanon's commercial banks rose an annual 27.98 percent to 37,183 billion Lebanese pounds at the end of 1996, the Bank of Lebanon said in its latest monthly bulletin.
Total deposits in foreign currencies and Lebanese pounds rose 28.47 percent to 30,685 billion pounds from 23,884 billion at the end of December 1995.
Lebanese pound deposits grew 48.45 percent to 13,351 billion pounds at the end of 1996 from 8,994 billion a year earlier.
Deposits in foreign currencies grew 19.71 percent to $11.169 billion from $9.33 billion a year earlier, the bank added.
Loans and credits to the private sector rose 22.94 percent in 1996 over 1995, increasing to 12,687 billion pounds from 10,320 billion pounds.
Credits in Lebanese pounds rose 26.93 percent to 1,623 billion pounds from 1,278 billion pounds.
Credits in foreign currencies to the private sector rose 25.84 percent to $7.129 billion from $5.665 billion.
